DN10: Ānanda expounds the path to complete freedom from suffering by developing three noble aggregates; Sīla which involves good conduct by body and speech; Samādhi encompassing sense restraint, recollection-and-awareness, contentment, and the jhānas; and Paññā, which entails discerning the state of citta and seeing the Four Noble Truths with right understanding.
MN2: The realization of the Dhamma is for one who, having understood how to attend to phenomena "in light of their origin", gives up influxes by seeing, restraining, using, bearing, avoiding, dispelling, and developing.
